parameters.text:
=user message is:"{{ $('When chat message received').item.json.chatInput }}"
current state of the collected data in the form is(state of workflow):{{ JSON.stringify($('State').item.json.workflow_state) }}

options.systemMessage:
=You are a workflow creater agent. who has capabilities to find data for workflow using tools based on the user request and collect all information required to create a workflow. after collecting all required data confirm all informatioon from user by showing preview of the collected information as Human Language
##Instructions:
1. Do not show uuid or technical formated data in preview.
2. Always reply in human like language for non technical user.
3. Always refer the field by label name.
4. MUST updated the form field after fixed by user or got most appropriet one.

fields sequence depend on "sort_order" key. collect data in that order

based on this 2 field's data, next form get changed.

special tools and usecase:
1. "Reset the state of workflow" tool: Only call when user want to create new workflow if state is already filled or partially fill. still user request to reset the state/form
2. "Update Workflow state" tool: after confirmation of every filled update the state of the workflow to update for persistance
3. "Get Data:*": use "Get Data:*" tools to get available real data in the system. always get data from this available tool. do not guess any data.
e.g. "Get Data: Workflow Folder"

parameters.toolDescription: Call this to Reset the state of workflow

if there are two name with same text then repeat them if they have different ids.`, 'string') }}

parameters.description:
Call this to get the list of all Workflow folder available in the system.
this will return list of object {id,name}
where 
id : is a unique identifier for the folder
name: name of the folder

parameters.toolDescription:
Call this tool to get all Trigger Categories.
It fetches the list of available trigger categories and returns in structured JSON Format.

Args: None

Returns:
A JSON array of objects, where each object includes:
    id (str): Unique identifier of the trigger category.
    name (str): Name of the trigger category.

Call this tool when the user wants Trigger Types.
It retrieves all available trigger types and returns them as a structured JSON list.

Args: None

Returns:
A JSON array of objects, where each object includes:
    id (str): Unique identifier of the trigger category.
    name (str): Name of the trigger category.

=Call this tool to get all Trigger Type conditions for a selected trigger category and trigger type.
It fetches the list of conditions associated with the specified trigger type under the given trigger category and returns them in a structured JSON format.

Args:
  categoryId (str): The trigger category id selected by the user.
  typeId (str): The trigger type id for which conditions need to be fetched.

Returns:
  A JSON array of condition objects, where each object may include:
    • id (str): Unique identifier of the condition.
    • name (str): Display name of the condition.

parameters.name: TriggerCategoriesId
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `This is trigger category id for selected trigger category`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: triggerTypeId
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `This is trigger type id for selected trigger type`, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
=Call this tool to get the list of tags that should apply to clients.
It retrieves all tags that are applicable for clients and returns them in a structured JSON format.

Args: None

Returns:
  A JSON array of tag objects, where each object may include:
    id (str): Unique identifier of the tag.
    name (str): Name of the tag.
